    • Method Detail

      • hasLength

        public static boolean hasLength(String str)
        Check that the given CharSequence is neither null nor of length 0. Note: Will return true for a CharSequence that purely consists of whitespace. 

         StringUtils.hasLength(null) = false
 StringUtils.hasLength("") = false
 StringUtils.hasLength(" ") = true
 StringUtils.hasLength("Hello") = true
        Parameters:
        str - the CharSequence to check (may be null)
        Returns:
        true if the CharSequence is not null and has length
        See Also:
        hasText(String)

      • hasText

        public static boolean hasText(String str)
        Check whether the given CharSequence has actual text. More specifically, returns true if the string not null, its length is greater than 0, and it contains at least one non-whitespace character. 

         StringUtils.hasText(null) = false
 StringUtils.hasText("") = false
 StringUtils.hasText(" ") = false
 StringUtils.hasText("12345") = true
 StringUtils.hasText(" 12345 ") = true
        Parameters:
        str - the CharSequence to check (may be null)
        Returns:
        true if the CharSequence is not null, its length is greater than 0, and it does not contain whitespace only
        See Also:
        Character.isWhitespace(char)

      • trimWhitespace

        public static String trimWhitespace(String str)
        Trim leading and trailing whitespace from the given String.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to check
        Returns:
        the trimmed String
        See Also:
        Character.isWhitespace(char)

      • getFileName

        public static String getFileName(String path)
        Parameters:
        path - A file like path
        Returns:
        The name of the path as if it was a file (the string after the last '/' or '\')

      • getParent

        public static String getParent(String path)
        Parameters:
        path - A file path
        Returns:
        Parent path of the input path as if it was a file. Empty string if the path has no parent.

      • getExtension

        public static String getExtension(String path)
        Parameters:
        path - The path (usually of a file)
        Returns:
        The file extension. Null if file name has no extension. For example 'file.xml' will return xml, 'file' will return null.

      • stripExtension

        public static String stripExtension(String path)
        Parameters:
        path - The path (usually of a file)
        Returns:
        The path without the extension. If the path has no extension the same path will be returned.

        For example 'file.xml' will return 'file', 'file' will return 'file'.

        public static String formatPath(String path)
        Replaces all backslashes in the path to slashes.
        Parameters:
        path - A path to format
        Returns:
        The input path with all backslashes replaced with slashes. Return empty string if the input path is null.

      • addTrailingSlash

        public static String addTrailingSlash(String path)
        Adds a slash to the end of the path if it doesn't already end with a slash. Whitespaces are also removed with trimWhitespace(String). 
         addTrailingSlash("/acb") = "abc/"
 addTrailingSlash("/acb   ") = "abc/"
 addTrailingSlash("/acb/") = "/abc/"
 addTrailingSlash("") = "/"
 addTrailingSlash(null) = null
        Parameters:
        path - The path to add the trailing slash
        Returns:
        A path with trailing slash at the end

      • safeStringEquals

        public static boolean safeStringEquals(String s1,
                       String s2)

      • getRelativePath

        public static String getRelativePath(String parentPath,
                     String childPath)

      • injectString

        public static String injectString(String str,
                  String toInject,
                  int injectionIndex)
        Inhects a string into another string at the specified location. 
         injectString("Arttory", "ifac", 3) = "Artifactory"
 injectString("rtifactory", "A", 0) = "Artifactory"
 injectString("Artifactor", "y", 10) = "Artifactory"
 injectString("Artifactory", "", 15) = "Artifactory"
        Parameters:
        str - the string to insert another string to
        toInject - string to inject
        injectionIndex - where
        Returns:
        The resulting string

      • getPathElements

        public static String[] getPathElements(String path)
        Returns the path elements of the input path. 
         getPathElements("/a/b/c") = [a, b, c]
 getPathElements("a/b/c") = [a, b, c]
 getPathElements("a/b/c/") = [a, b, c]
 getPathElements("a") = [a]
 getPathElements("") = []
        Parameters:
        path - The path to parse (can be absolute or relative)
        Returns:
        The path's path elements

      • getAncesstor

        public static String getAncesstor(String path,
                  int depth)
        Get the ancesstor path based on the specified depth
        Parameters:
        path - The path to compute the ncesstor for
        depth - The depth
        Returns:
        The ancesstor path
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If depth is bigger than the number of path compponents

      • getFirstPathElement

        public static String getFirstPathElement(String path)
        Returns the first path element of the input path. 
         getFirstPathElement("/a/b/c") = "a"
 getFirstPathElement("a/b/c") = "a"
 getFirstPathElement("a") = "a"
 getFirstPathElement("") = ""
        Parameters:
        path - The path to parse (can be absolute or relative)
        Returns:
        The path's path elements

      • getLastPathElement

        public static String getLastPathElement(String path)
        Returns the last path element of the input path. 
         getFirstPathElement("/a/b/c") = "c"
 getFirstPathElement("a/b/c") = "c"
 getFirstPathElement("a") = "a"
 getFirstPathElement("") = ""
        Parameters:
        path - The path to parse (can be absolute or relative)
        Returns:
        The path's path elements

      • stripFirstPathElement

        public static String stripFirstPathElement(String path)
        Strips the first path element from the input path. 
         stripFirstPathElement("/a/b/c") = "b/c"
 stripFirstPathElement("a/b/c/") = "b/c/"
 stripFirstPathElement("a") = ""
 stripFirstPathElement("/") = ""
 stripFirstPathElement("") = ""
 stripFirstPathElement(null) = null
        Parameters:
        path - The path to strip from (can be absolute or relative)
        Returns:
        The path without the first path element

        public static boolean isDirectoryPath(String path)
